text: Rochechouart () is a commune in the Haute-Vienne department in the Nouvelle- Aquitaine region in west central France. It is a subprefecture of the Haute- Vienne department. It is also the capital of the arrondissement of the same name. ==Geography== Rochechouart is in the western part of the Haute-Vienne department, along the valley of the Grêne river. The confluence of the Grêne with the Vayres river is to the south of the town. Another river, the Gorre, forms the northeastern border of the commune. The city of Rochechouart is at about west of Limoges, the largest town and capital of the department, from Bordeaux and from Paris. The commune has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The commune of Rochechouart is surrounded by the communes: ===Climate=== The climate of Rochechouart, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Rochechouart are known, in French, as Rochechouartais (women: Rochechouartaises). With a population of 3,798, Rochechouart has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is part of the intercommunality Porte Océane du Limousin (). === Twinned and partner towns === Rochechouart is twinned with: * Oettingen, Germany == Gallery == File:Rochechouart chateau.jpg|Rochechouart castle. File:Rochechouart eglise vgen.jpg|The Saint-Sauveur church in Rochechouart. ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Rochechouart * Communes of the Haute- Vienne department ==References== ==Other websites== * City Council website Category:Subprefectures in France Category:Communes in Haute-Vienne
